column1: SPATIAL CONFLICT RISK REGISTER — House #415 Mediterranean
Largest of 3 plans — dual crane phases, two-story scaffold conflicts, and Mediterranean exterior complexity create multiple critical spatial clashes

column7: Full site lockdown on pour day. Two pumps South + West. No other deliveries. Book concrete plant Friday before
One crane cannot do both in same lift. Sequence: Great Room Mon AM, Foyer Wed AM. Crane repositions between
Crane moves to West position for garage headers after main beams. Clear West staging entirely
Exterior crane lifts joists East. Interior scaffold team works Center simultaneously. Crane arc must not cross scaffold zone
Crane active South for roof. Interior scaffold active Center. Banksman required. Define no-cross zones clearly
Clay tile must NOT be delivered before structural engineer signs off on roof framing. Sequence is non-negotiable
Designate 2 scaffold gaps at South for material pass-through. All deliveries weeks 17-20 via South gaps only
South scaffold must have clear bay at porch zone. Masonry crew and stucco crew coordinate daily to avoid collision
Both arriving same zone same week. Stage flagstone Monday, columns Wednesday. Forklift shared resource – book in advance
Scaffold gaps for window pass-through. Windows delivered just-in-time. Stucco crew moves to opposite elevation
Stair below porch level. Sequence: porch columns complete → then stair. Shared South staging area

column3: HVAC air handler (crane lift to attic)
column7: Crane needed for HVAC unit to attic zone. Roof tilers move to South slope while crane lifts North. Coordinate daily
All three specialty ceilings happen weeks 23-25. Interior scaffold is a shared resource. One crew per room. Schedule: Rotunda Mon-Fri Wk23, Coffered Wk24, Tray Wk24 parallel
Paint foyer walls BEFORE chandelier install. Chandelier fragile – no overspray. Sequence: paint → dry → chandelier
LVL beams ordered week 1. Lumber co. engineering takes 3-4 weeks. If delayed, framing halts. Track weekly from week 1
